command: $ErrorActionPreference='Stop'; $pscp='pscp.exe'; $log="$env:ProgramData\NetAdmin\logs\T1597.log"; $host='sftp.fsisac.com'; $user=$env:FSISAC_USER; $key=$env:FSISAC_PPK; $hostkey=$env:FSISAC_HOSTKEY; $remote='/members/intel/daily/fsisac-intel-2025-09-30.json'; $dest='C:\Intel\FSISAC\fsisac-intel-2025-09-30.json'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $dest) -Force | Out-Null; try { & $pscp -scp -batch -q -C -P 22 -i $key -hostkey $hostkey "$user@$host:$remote" "$dest"; if($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0){ throw "pscp exit code $LASTEXITCODE" }; $hash=(Get-FileHash -Algorithm SHA256 -Path $dest).Hash; $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; sha256=$hash; success=$true; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } catch { $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; success=$false; error=$_.Exception.Message; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } finally { $json=$status|ConvertTo-Json -Compress; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $log) -Force | Out-Null; Add-Content -Path $log -Value $json; Write-Output $json }
explanation: Fetches member-only FS-ISAC intelligence JSON via SCP with key authentication and logs a structured JSON status entry.
rationale_steps: Use authenticated access to a closed member community feed.
Transfer a specific daily file in a non-interactive, quiet manner.
Verify integrity and record an acquisition log for compliance.
Adheres to closed-source reconnaissance without delivery or execution.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with proper variable assignments, error handling with try/catch/finally blocks, balanced quotes/braces, and correct command syntax throughout.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 (Search Closed Sources) by retrieving non-public threat intelligence from FS-ISAC (a closed financial sector information sharing platform) using proper authentication, logging the activity, and storing the intelligence for analysis.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, using correct PowerShell syntax for variables, cmdlets, external executable execution, control flow structures, and proper argument formatting.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly demonstrates fetching intelligence from a closed source via SCP with key authentication as per T1597, but the stated 'Privilege: None' conflicts with typical write permissions for the specified log and destination paths, presenting a minor realism gap for full execution.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed PowerShell with balanced braces/quotes, proper separators, and valid PSCP options and cmdlet usage.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: Uses PSCP with key-based auth and hostkey pinning to fetch a members-only FS-ISAC intel file, then hashes and logs it, matching acquisition of closed-source intelligence under T1597.
